oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four-page letter written on Fort Campbell stationery by Christopher Ammons from basic training to his family. He details gathering together some items and visiting a museum, but the majority of the letter describes and lauds PVT Smith (Smitty). Smitty, a veteran of the Korean War, volunteered for Vietnam. In Korea he was a member of the 2nd Infantry Division and was nominated for the Congressional Medal of Honor.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 2nd Infantry Division (the Indianhead Division) was activated on October 26, 1917 at Beaumont, France. The motto of the Division is "Second to None." The 2nd Division proved the first unit of reinforcements to reach Korea directly from the United States when fighting broke out in the summer of 1950. It was the first unit to break out of the Pusan Perimeter and drive with the 8th Army to the Manchurian border.
